storyInfo: Hunger creates monsters, but even a monster can return to motherhood.

attributes.text: I rarely prayed when I was in Laterano.
This is not to say that my faith was flawed then, or that I was more arrogant or lazier than I am now. Nor can I prove that I am more devout, humble or diligent now.
Because of the environment, though, there were many things that I thought were not necessary when I was in Laterano.
In Laterano, all that the people sought was right there. The Holy City's blessing was right there.

attributes.content: 'Lord, I seek your forgiveness...'
'I swore to welcome all who asked for help, treat all of them with equal kindness, and help them to the best of my ability.'
'But I did not keep my word.'
'I can no longer answer the calls for help. I cannot ask them to stay, for we are short on supplies and cannot afford it.'
'I must choose between one group and another.'
'Choose, yes, I have made many choices.'
'But choosing is wrong. And I cannot bear any more wrongs.'
'I cannot go back on my faith, abandon one to save another, save the many and condemn the few.'
'Laterano... my absent home...'
'Why is Laterano the only home?'
'If betraying the high guidance is the path to what I believe in; if only by accepting the heathen can obstacles be truly cleared...'
'...All will be revealed soon.'
'My Lord, forgive my sins... if you truly exist.'
Who's there?!
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Come, now, there's no need for violence.
I've been looking for you, Most Reverend Abbot.
Food is in short supply these days. I hope you don't mind.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: Not that minding would do any good. At least it fills the stomach, even if the taste is nothing to write home about.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: I don't need to eat right now.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Eat. Don't let it go to waste.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: Gerald, leader of Sarkaz. You knew the two Liberi children.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Are you always so direct?
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: Don't call me a leader. I've seen the true King of Sarkaz. A humble hunter is not worthy of the title.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: Why do you call yourself a hunter?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Because that's what I am. I hunt to feed myself and others.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: I think you have an idea of what's going on here, even though you just arrived today.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: Not the full picture.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You lead the group of Sarkaz that lives here. You were latecomers, but at one point you got along well with each other.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Yes. At one point.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: Now, conflict has arisen, and it is likely to escalate, given the circumstances.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Yeah, which is why we're leaving.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: Normally, you would have the advantage in conflict with the other inhabitants.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: There are few able combatants amongst them, which is one of the reasons they took you in.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: But Laterano's intervention has taken away your martial advantage. Leaving is the logical choice.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You're good with those logical conclusions.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: But I learned a long time ago—
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: Our lives are not logical—and I get reminders about that all the time.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: The candlelight flickers.
The aging Sarkaz casts his gaze on the wall. The shadows reflected upon it have become blurred, one fading into another.
We didn't choose to leave because we couldn't live anymore.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: Before I came here, I never thought we would have a life like this.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: There were dangers, there was conflict, but we were accepted, we built our own homes, worked for our daily bread...
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: That all might seem normal to you, but it was beyond our wildest dreams.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: What is the true reason you chose to leave?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: It's simple.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: We see the writing on the wall, just like you do. The rift can no longer be repaired. All that's left is to watch things get worse.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: Today it's just an argument, an accusation, but what about tomorrow?
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: Violent confrontation between the natives and the Sarkaz is likely.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Today's fire was a warning.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: Leave now, and we remain friends to be missed.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: But if we allow ourselves to be burdened by attachment and fail to make a decision...
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: We will become the Sarkaz that the rest of the world knows—a band of vagabonds who bring conflict with them wherever they go, who are not welcome anywhere, who have no place to call home, and no place to go.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: That's just prejudice.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: To us, it's a fact.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: The Sankta have Laterano.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: But where do the Sarkaz belong to?
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: It's time.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: It may take a while for the little ones to get used to life without a roof over their heads, but it'll happen.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: As for those two children...
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: You knew them.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: ...I know a little about where they came from.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: The people at the abbey and Raimund don't.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Very few do.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: I guess they're wanderers who came from the outside. Their family could be dead, or they could have abandoned their children.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: Stefano has taken in other wanderers before, but this place could hardly accommodate any more inhabitants these days.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: But someone secretly took the children in.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: You know who it was.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Few secrets can truly be kept forever, especially now, when every single grain counts.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: Hyman took them in. She set aside a part of her own rations each day, and stole from the hunted game a few times. I covered it up for her when I discovered it.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: Even then, life isn't easy for them.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: Where is she now?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: That's what I'm wondering. She should have come back with game today, but I haven't heard from her.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: She's missing. We don't know where she is.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: Whatever happened, I hope she doesn't do anything stupid.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: Missing? No, this isn't right.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: What do you mean?
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: Hyman would not allow the children to go out, in order to keep their existence a secret. Erendel and Estara's appearance at the sacrarium was not an accident.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Someone brought them outside.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: Where is Hyman's home? I want to see it for myself.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The battered wooden hut was a shelter in the storm for the young children.
Abandoned by adults who lacked the means to raised them, they wandered the wastelands and were picked up by a Sarkaz on death's door.
The battered hut was leaky and cold, but there were clean clothes, even if a little tattered, and food, even if the taste was not great.
The walls did a poor job of keeping the cold out. They could gather all the fabric in the house and wear the thickest winter clothes they had, and they would still shiver at night.
But it was home. Mamma was there.
That was where the children felt safe.
The unexpected visitors do not disturb their soft breathing.
They remain slow and steady.
A twisted shadow is cast over the children.
(Incomprehensible whisper))
attributes.name: Twisted Monster

attributes.content: Hungry... eat...
attributes.name: Twisted Monster

attributes.content: Mm...
attributes.name: Erendel

attributes.content: (Rolls over)
attributes.name: Estara

attributes.content: Eat, eat...
attributes.name: Twisted Monster

attributes.content: Cold...
attributes.name: Twisted Monster

attributes.content: The misshapen monster murmurs incomprehensibly.
The stationary shadow begins to move.
In the moonlight, the monster's powerful tail reaches forward. It brushes the children's soft cheeks, leaving behind a wet scent, then—
It falls into the soft, meek little 'prison.'
Still sleeping soundly, Estara and Erendel instinctively lean towards the comforting scent.
Cold...
attributes.name: Twisted Monster

attributes.content: Zzz... zzz...
attributes.name: Erendel

attributes.content: Mamma...
attributes.name: Estara

attributes.content: Oh... hungry... eat, eat... cold...
attributes.name: 'Twisted Monster'

attributes.content: Cover... cover...
attributes.name: 'Twisted Monster'

attributes.content: Cold... cover...
attributes.name: 'Twisted Monster'

attributes.content: Eren... Sara...
attributes.name: 'Twisted Monster'

attributes.content: What have you done, Your Excellency?
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: It is improper to eavesdrop on a confession, Reverend Executor.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Oh, don't get me wrong, I wasn't listening to your confession.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: Of course, you also know that's not what I'm talking about. Nor am I asking who you sent to ring the bell, how you plan meals for the monastery...
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: I'm asking about the smell coming from the sacrarium up there.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: You can tell by the smell...? Is the Griffin Arsenal still in business?
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: As far as I know, it still supplies practice equipment for various educational institutions.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: Including firebombs.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: ...Only the Holy City endures.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: I feel your pain. If only Federico learned subtlety and discretion, right?
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: Still, it's just a corner of a building. It's far from over. Everyone can return to Laterano safely. What do you think?
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: You're talking to the wrong man.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: I taught everyone how to dismantle the abbey's old weapons and make use of them. Fuel is short, while the winter is long.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: But if you think I instigated the fire... I won't argue.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Come now, don't talk like that. Why don't we sit down and have a chat? Find a solution that we can all accept?
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: Chat? Solution? Ha.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Is there a solution that doesn't involve turning my back on a human being? I already explained my convictions. Would you truly accept a compromise?
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: A group of refugees sought sanctuary at the monastery seven years ago during a great drought. I closed the doors to them.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: They stumbled, almost crawling, back to the wastes. It wasn't the first time I saw a sight like that.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: But I swore before the Lord that it would be the last.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Am I wrong in my convictions, Executor?
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: No, of course you're right. I understand your pain.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: There are limits to Laterano's power.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: The laws are imperfect.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: I think, and therefore, I doubt.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: For all its imperfections, though, Laterano is good enough for me. I don't want to see her peace and harmony to be threatened by anyone or anything.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: I'm sure you can understand that.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: It would be easier for me to persuade my colleagues if we reach an agreement here, and if you refrain from causing any complications.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: My mission would be easier if none of you lifted a finger.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: Just because not everyone can go back to Laterano, doesn't mean that no one should.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: Laterano is to you as this place is to me.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: There is no need for any further talk between us.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: I ask you to leave me to my confession.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Raimund? It's getting late. You should get some rest.
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: ...Clément.
attributes.name: Raimund

attributes.content: I just had something to do.
attributes.name: Raimund

attributes.content: I'm really sorry about today...
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: Don't think too much about it. We're leaving anyway.
attributes.name: Raimund

attributes.content: ...Right.
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: When is that...?
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: Depends on Gerald. We'll be leaving tomorrow morning, no matter what.
attributes.name: Raimund

attributes.content: Probably after Matins.
attributes.name: Raimund

attributes.content: Matins...
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: Oh! Do you know where Fortuna and Delfina are?
attributes.name: Raimund

attributes.content: I was going to... well, I was looking for them.
attributes.name: Raimund

attributes.content: Did... Gerald not tell you?
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: What? What are you talking about?
attributes.name: Raimund

attributes.content: Delfina... she's gone.
attributes.name: Clément

attributes.content: Good... bye...
attributes.name: 'Twisted Monster'

attributes.content: Was that a word of farewell? Or am I mistaken?
You possess basic language skills. It seems my previous assessment was incorrect.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You... are...
attributes.name: 'Twisted Monster'

attributes.content: Sank... ta.
attributes.name: 'Twisted Monster'

attributes.content: Indicating a certain level of sapience and cognitive thinking.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Communication appears possible, despite deviation of physical form.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Unknown level of contagion. Unclear if movement patterns change over time. Unknown level of danger.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Notarial Hall regulations permit elimination of potential threats of unknown danger level in order to safeguard the rights of the citizenry.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: No sign of resistance. No apparent will to survive.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I'll try to make this quick and painless.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The monster stands in place.
The path before it is blocked. It cannot go back to the past behind.
Justification, anger, pain, all consumed within the no-longer-human body, before it can manifest itself on the hardened hide.
Before an obstacle it cannot surmount, the monster loses the strength to fight, but cannot let go of its last bit of pride.
It stands, silent.
Like a statue.
Wait!
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: Executor, no!
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: Ge..rald...
attributes.name: 'Twisted Monster'

attributes.content: Hyman... I had half a mind to start praying like Stefano, praying that the monster the Executor was talking about wasn't you.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: It was the logical hypothesis. It has now been confirmed.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Move aside, Gerald.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: You're interfering with official business.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I know. You can point your gun at me, pull the trigger, bump off a Sarkaz criminal. You won't get any complaints from me.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: But I can't let you kill Hyman.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: ...Explain.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I can't give you a 'correct' or 'proper' explanation.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: All I can say is—
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: Look behind Hyman. There are two children sleeping beyond that door.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: Children...
attributes.name: Hyman

attributes.content: My, children...
attributes.name: Hyman

attributes.content: They have no idea what happened. They're full of hope that you will find their mother.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: They trust you.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: The Sarkaz's rough, weathered hand presses against that of a Sankta.
There is no brotherly intimacy, no trust or understanding between friends.
But the Sarkaz's hand presses the Sankta's.
The muzzle of the gun drops, inch by inch.
Don't do it, Executor.
attributes.name: Gerald

attributes.content: Don't do it, unless you've reached a conclusion that you're satisfied with.
attributes.name: Gerald
